result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deongelo Marquis Hardy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deongelo M Hardy in court in person.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Deongelo M Hardy.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #10CF2308. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Frey State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.24.22

Defendant Deongelo M Hardy in court with audio only with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia who appears by video.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Hardy is unable to appear by video and is ordered to appear in person on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.15.2022
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Devan M S.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Deongelo M Hardy in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Deongelo M Hardy in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deongelo M Hardy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
